attributes.title: Physical stock verification
attributes.description:
The table below shows the summary of the stock findings on 12.06.2025

·           The following were the stock findings;

ü  Yeast -      -125g.

ü  Bread -     -46 loaves.

ü  Cumulative variance in polybags was +26pieces.

All other materials had negligible variances.
attributes.recommendation: ·           The management to ensure that the set stock controls are consistently adhered to avoid stock variances.
attributes.effect: Minimal variances noted in stock items is an indication that stock controls are being observed.

value: ·           More improvement measures will be initiated.
Control is ok and will maintain the trend
Physical stock verified on 08.04.2025 showed minimal item variation.
Previous

·           A stock take exercise was conducted on 12.06.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets such as the production materials and the finished products.
+ Stock count showed minimal item variation hence strong internal controls.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring strong internal controls.

attributes.title: Dough weight analysis.
attributes.description:
1)      Dough weights:

·          The below table shows analysis of dough weights sampled on 13/06/2025;

Dough weights sampled on 07.06.2025:(2 shift @04.50pm)

Dough weights showed high overweight rate.
attributes.recommendation: + High overweight dough rate should be addressed through adhering to set dough dividing weight ranges.
attributes.effect: + High dough weight rate suggest overweight bread production and this means yield targets were not realized and this imply revenue loss.

value: + High overweight dough rate will be addressed through frequent spot checks to verify dough weights production.
+ We will sensitize dough dividers on the importance of adhering to set dough dividing weight range.
+ Overweight dough samples were noted on 12.04.25.
Previous
·         Sample varieties of dough  were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ High dough weight rate show noncompliance to adhering to set dough weights.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that dough is divided adhering to set standard weights.

attributes.title: Packed bread weight analysis
attributes.description:
1)      Packed bread weight:

·         Bread weights were sampled on 12/06/2025 and the following below were the results.

+ Several over and underweight loaves were noted.
attributes.recommendation: +  Few over and underweight loaves noted should be addressed.
attributes.effect:
+ Overweight bread presence suggests inconsistency during dough dividing.

+ High overweight bread on the other end deprives the company revenues because this lowers expected yields.

value: + Bread weight extremes were within the allowed range but few over and underweight pieces noted will be addressed.
+ Over and underweight loaves were minimal however few noted weight extremes will be addressed.
+ High overweight bread rate was noted for bread weighed on 11.04.2025.
Previous
Sample varieties of  packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
+ Bread weight extremes were within the allowed 10% range on aggregate. However, few over and underweight loaves were noted meaning noncompliance to adhering to set standard weight bread production.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread damages analysis
attributes.description:
·          Both market and production damages were analyzed from 01/05/2025 - 11/06/2025.

PRODUCTION DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Production damage rate is tabulated below.

MARKET DAMAGE ANALYSIS:

·          Market damage rate is tabulated below.
attributes.recommendation:
·          Proper baking processes will ensure that damages are fully checked.

·          The management should focus on efforts to manage bread damages to ensure that the company doesn’t lose revenues as observed.
attributes.effect: + Both market and production damages were within the tolerable rate and this implies that the company is not exposed to losses and revenue targets were realized.

value: We will put more efforts to manage bread damages at accepted levels.
We will continue to put more efforts to ensure that we control bread damages.
• April 2025 audit report highlighted high production damages (0.22% of total bread produced as analyzed from 09.03.25 – 08.04.25.
Previous

·          The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within expected/set limits. High damages suggest bread of inferior quality produced.

·          Production damage rate allowed is 0.2% of total production while market damage allowed is 0.5% of net sales.
+ Adherence to tolerable bread damage rate showed compliance to set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring bread damages are managed to set tolerable levels.

attributes.title: Broken bread damages (sent to ingredients)-Analysis
attributes.description:
·          As per the records, there was 476.2kg of bread damages that was to be sent to ingredients department.

·           A total of 404.3kg was sent over the same period to ingredients department hence the expected physical balance was 71.9kg.

·           On the spot-check day (12.06.2025) 74kg of bread damages was found giving a variance of +2.1kg (5.25loaves).

 Below is a summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·           The branch management should ensure that all bread damages are correctly recorded and sent to the ingredients department as per the company policy as observed.
attributes.effect: Minimal variance noted implies proper accountability of broken bread damages.

value: We will continue ensuring proper accountability of damages as per stipulated policies.
Accountability of all production damages will be observed.
April 2025 audit report highlighted that broken bread damages were properly accounted for as analyzed from 09.03.25 – 08.04.2025.
Previous
·           Bread damages recorded from 01/06/2025 – 12/06/2025 was compared with the damages sent and the physical damages in the branch to identify if the branch accounted for all bread damages.
+ Broken bread damages were properly accounted for as per company policy.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring broken bread damages destined for ingredients department is fully accounted for.

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check analysis.
attributes.description:
·          Mini shop spot check was conducted on 12.06.2025.

·         The shop attendant accounted for all the bread loaded.

·         All sales were made through Mpesa till.

·         The below table shows details of mini shop transactions.
attributes.recommendation: + The Mini shop attendant should keep up with the observed good stock and cash control.
attributes.effect: Mini shop SOPs are followed.

value: + Accountability and controls noted at the mini shop will always be ensured.
+ Controls on mini shop to be maintained.
+ April 2025 audit report highlighted that mini shop bread and crates were accounted for properly as per spot check conducted on 09.04.2025.
Previous
·          A spot check was conducted in the mini shop to assess whether their operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.
+ Bread and crates at the mini shop were properly accounted for.
Sales Department
+ Ensuring that mini shop SOPs are adhered to.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis
attributes.description:
Below are the summary of the findings

                                         01/05/25 – 31.05.2025

                                        

01/06/25 – 11.06.2025

·          The above tables shows that;

·          There was no significant variance between system and the actual material consumption.

·          Correct posting was also noted over the audited period.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set consumption and production standards.
attributes.effect: Consumption and production set standards were observed and this implies proper accountability of raw materials and finished goods.

value: ·           This is noted and will be maintained.
We will always ensure that actual production is reflected on production records/registers.
+ Aril 2025 audit report highlighted that set consumption recipes were adhered to as analyzed from 09.03.25 - 08.04.2025.
Previous
·          Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 01.05.25 – 11.06.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.
+ Raw material consumption quantities were as per set standards hence compliance to set consumption standards.
Operations/Production Department
+ Adherence to set consumption standard quantities.

attributes.title: Mixing charts/summaries analysis
attributes.description:
·          From 01/05/2024 – 11/06/2025, aggregate yield (after conversion to 400g) ranged from 191.20 – 191.90lvs/bag, with an average of 191.87lvs/bag.

·          From 2,881bags, total yield expected was 552,764pcs (upon conversion to 400g) and 552,764pcs was reflected on production records. Thus expected yields realized.

·          Breakdown of yields for the various bread varieties is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: + Noted realization of yield targets is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Revenue targets were realized.

value: + We will ensure set yields are always produced and recorded.
+ We will always ensure that set standard yields are realized.
+ April 2025 audit report highlighted that set yields were realized.
Previous

·          The exercise was conducted to determine if resulting yields for each variety matched expected yields (as per set BOMs) and also establish the consistency. Low yields than expected would be translated as concealing of actual yields denying the company revenues.
+ Bread yields recorded on mixing charts/summaries matched those set as per BOM hence compliant with set policies.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring bread yields resulting match those set as per BOM.

attributes.title: Outstanding customer debts analysis.
attributes.description: ·         Outstanding debts for customers was Kshs.406,822.50 while for institutions was Kshs.1, 211,566.05.
attributes.recommendation: + Sales team must ensure credit limits for institutions are set and follow up as well as other customer debts.
attributes.effect: + High route balances without equal security deposit poses a great risk to the company of bad debts.

value:
·         Credit limit is set for institutions.

We don’t supply customers with outstanding debts in that the SAP system is locked such that it doesn’t allow invoicing for such customers.
·         Will follow up with the sales rep and the TSM, at the moment all customers with balances aren’t supplied until the debt is cleared.
April 2025 audit report highlighted outstanding customer balances as at 11.04.2025.
Previous
·         Analysis of the branch outstanding balances as at 12th June 2025 for routes and institutions was done to determine the debtors’ value and if the company is exposed to bad debts.
+ Outstanding debts were noted which was contrary to the company policy of no credit terms to route customers hence noncompliance.
Finance Department
+ Ensuring bread sales are in cash and no credit terms for route customers.

attributes.title: Production efficiency analysis
attributes.description: ·          efficiency is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·          Branch management should ensure proper planning to ensure set production efficiency is realized as observed.
attributes.effect: + Adherence to set production efficiency implied that production costs were checked.

value: + We always do prior production plan to ensure that set production efficiency is realized.
+ Noted adherence to set production efficiency will be maintained.
+ April 2025 audit report highlighted adherence to set operational efficiencies as analyzed from 09.03.25 – 08.04.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set production and packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·          Standard production efficiency is 4.5bags/staff.
+ Set production efficiency was realized.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring adherence to set production efficiency standards.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency analysis.
attributes.description: ·          Packing efficiency (01/05/2025 – 11/06/25) is tabulated below;
attributes.recommendation: ·          Branch management should ensure proper planning to address noted packing inefficiency.
attributes.effect: + Noted packing inefficiency increased production costs.

value: + Packing inefficiency noted will be addressed. However, set packing efficiency was almost realized.
+ Packing inefficiency noted will be addressed.
April 2025 audit report highlighted adherence to set packing efficiency as analyzed from 09.03.25 – 08.04.25.
Previous

·          This test was conducted to determine if set  packing efficiency was adhered to. Low efficiency would indicate increased production costs.

·        Packing efficiency was set at 1455pcs/person/8hr shift.
+ Packing efficiency was not realized hence noncompliance.
Operations/Production Department
+ Ensuring set packing efficiency standards are adhered to in order to check production costs.

attributes.title: Motor vehicle mileage and fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description: Analysis for motor vehicle fuel consumption was carried out from 01/05/2025 – 31/05/2025 and results were analyzed on the below table.
attributes.recommendation: ·          Noted economical fuel consumption for most sales vans is commendable.
attributes.effect: + Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs.

value: ·          Daily monitoring of vans is always ensured to observe fuel consumption set policies.
·          We will maintain the observed trend.
+ April 2025 audit report highlighted economical vehicle fuel consumption as analyzed during March 2025.
Previous

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans a was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ Fuel consumption was as per expected set standards.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring fuel consumption is as per set consumption rate.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
·           Generator fuel consumption from 22/02/2025 – 12/06/2025.

·           Below is a tabular illustration of generator consumption.

GENERATOR : (01/05/25 - 12/06/25)

·           Set standard fuel consumption for the generator was not provided.
attributes.recommendation: ·          The branch management should liaise with KAF to have set fuel consumption standard for the generator.
attributes.effect: + Having no set fuel consumption rate for the generator imply generator fuel consumption cannot be determined and accounted for.

value: + We purchase fuel upon directions from head quarters and drain all fuel purchased.
+ We will engage KAF to arrange and test the generator and determine its standard fuel consumption rate.
+ Generator had no set standard fuel consumption as noted during previous audit.
Previous

·           The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by  generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
+ The generator had no set standard fuel consumption rate to track its fuel consumption.
Transport/Fleet Department
+ Ensuring economical fuel consumption by the generator.
